# hv_vcpu_create(_:_:)

**Function**

Creates a vCPU instance for the current thread.

## Declaration

```swift
func hv_vcpu_create(_ vcpu: UnsafeMutablePointer<hv_vcpuid_t>, _ flags: hv_vcpu_options_t) -> hv_return_t
```

## Parameters

- **vcpu**: An argument that the hypervisor populates with the instance of a vCPU on a successful return.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/HV_SUCCESS] if the operation was successful, otherwise an error code specified in [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/hv_return_t].

## Discussion

Intel-based Mac computers have different parameters:

- `flags`: The vCPU creation flag. The available flags are [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/HV_VCPU_ACCEL_RDPMC], [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/HV_VCPU_TSC_RELATIVE], and [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/HV_VCPU_DEFAULT]. The default is [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/HV_VCPU_DEFAULT].



## Creation and destruction

- **hv_vm_get_max_vcpu_count(_:)**: Returns the maximum number of vCPUs that the hypervisor supports.
- **hv_vcpu_destroy(_:)**: Destroys the vCPU instance associated with the current thread.
- **hv_vcpu_t**: An opaque value that represents a vCPU instance.
